question_text: Which of the following statements related to the safety of biomedical instruments  are TRUE?
option1: When a person is exposed to an electrical hazard, let-go current is defined as the  maximum current at which the subject can withdraw voluntarily
option2: Microshock is a physiological response resulting from an electrical current  passing through heart
option3: The patient in an intensive care unit is being exposed to the danger of microshock  because of using internal conductive electrodes in the vicinity of the heart
option4: The 50 Hz safe current limit for a microshock is greater than 50 mA

option1: Latitude of a place varies from 0 degree to 90 degree North or South, and Longitude  varies from 0 degree to 180 degree East or West of Greenwich Meridian.
option2: Latitude of a place varies from 0 degree to 180 degree East or West of Greenwich  Meridian, and Longitude varies from 0 degree to 90 degree North or South.
option3: Longitude of a point is the angle between the Greenwich Meridian and the meridian  passing through that point.
option4: Latitude and Longitude of a place are subject to change with time.               Page 33 of 43

option1: a systematic representation of latitude and longitude lines on a plane (paper) map.
option2: a representation of 3D shape of Earth on 2D plane.
option3: dependent on the location of area on the Earth.
option4: required for taking theodolite observations of horizontal angles.

The correlation coefficient between two bands of remote sensing data that would  yield good classification is
In a covariance matrix, the main diagonal shows the ______ of each band.
Choose the INCORRECT statement about image segmentation in digital image  processing.
option1: Segmentation divides an image into different regions.
option2: Image segmentation does not help in image classification.
option3: Segmentation helps to identify objects or boundaries.
option4: Segmentation is a process of partitioning an image into multiple sets of similar  pixels.

question_text: Assuming the material considered in each statement is homogeneous, isotropic, linear  elastic, and the deformations are in the elastic range, which one or more of the  following statement(s) is/are TRUE?
option1: A body subjected to hydrostatic pressure has no shear stress.
option2: If a long solid steel rod is subjected to tensile load, then its volume increases.
option3: Maximum shear stress theory is suitable for failure analysis of brittle materials.
option4: If a portion of a beam has zero shear force, then the corresponding portion of the  elastic curve of the beam is always straight.

option1: The magnitude of the vertical reaction force at A is larger than that at B.
